CODIF_DATA.HEADING: BR405

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: EBGU - Renovering af affaldsindsamlingssteder
EBWE - Sanierung von Abfallsammelstellen

BERD - Rehabilitación de los puntos de recogida de residuos

EBOR - Obnova točk za zbiranje odpadkov

TI_DOC.P: EBGU - Renovering af affaldsindsamlingssteder (TJ-Kurgantyube)

CONTENTS.P: Project name: Kurgan-Tyube Solid Waste Project
Country: Tajikistan
Business sector: MEI
Project ID: 8961-IFT-43754
Funding source: EBRD and grant
Type of contract: Small Works
Type of notice: Invitation for tenders
Issue date: 2.2.2018
Closing date: 5.3.2018, 14:00 pm local time
1. This invitation for tenders follows the general procurement notice for this project, which was published, on the EBRD website on 30.7.2015.

2. The State Unitary Enterprise “Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali” (“KMK”) in Kurgan-Tyube City hereinafter referred to as the employer, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan and grant from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of Kurgan-Tyube Solid Waste Project.
3. The employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan:
— Rehabilitation of waste collection points.
4. Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
5. To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria which are further detailed in the tender documents:
a) average annual turnover is not less than 200 000 USD, calculated as total payments received for contracts in progress or completed, within the last 3 years,
b) cash-flow requirement is 40 000 USD,

c) the tenderer shall demonstrate that it has successful experience as prime contractor in the execution of at least two contracts of a nature and complexity comparable to the proposed contract within the last 3 years,

d) participation as contractor or management contractor in at least 2 contracts within the last 3 years, each with a value of at least 80 000 USD, that have been successfully and substantially completed and that are similar to the proposed works,
6. Tender documents are available electronically, on a free of charge basis,

7. Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 5 March at 14:00 pm local time, at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend.
State committee on investments and State Property Management of the Republic of Tajikistan, 27 Shohtemur Street, Dushanbe, Republic of Tajikistan.
8. The Applicable procurement rules are bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at http//www.ebrd.com/news/pulications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html
9. Prospective tenderers may obtain the tender documents, and further information through the following contract details:

TI_DOC.P: EBWE - Sanierung von Abfallsammelstellen (TJ-Kurgantyube)

1. This invitation for tenders follows the general procurement notice for this project, which was published, on the EBRD website on 30.7.2015.

2. The State Unitary Enterprise “Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali” (“KMK”) in Kurgan-Tyube City hereinafter referred to as the employer, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan and grant from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of Kurgan-Tyube Solid Waste Project.
3. The employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan:
— Rehabilitation of waste collection points.
4. Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
5. To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria which are further detailed in the tender documents:
a) average annual turnover is not less than 200 000 USD, calculated as total payments received for contracts in progress or completed, within the last 3 years,
b) cash-flow requirement is 40 000 USD,

c) the tenderer shall demonstrate that it has successful experience as prime contractor in the execution of at least two contracts of a nature and complexity comparable to the proposed contract within the last 3 years,

d) participation as contractor or management contractor in at least 2 contracts within the last 3 years, each with a value of at least 80 000 USD, that have been successfully and substantially completed and that are similar to the proposed works,
6. Tender documents are available electronically, on a free of charge basis,

7. Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 5 March at 14:00 pm local time, at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend.
State committee on investments and State Property Management of the Republic of Tajikistan, 27 Shohtemur Street, Dushanbe, Republic of Tajikistan.
8. The Applicable procurement rules are bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at http//www.ebrd.com/news/pulications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html

Type of notice: Invitation for tenders
Issue date: 2.2.2018
Closing date: 5.3.2018, 14:00 pm local time
1. This invitation for tenders follows the general procurement notice for this project, which was published, on the EBRD website on 30.7.2015.

2. The State Unitary Enterprise “Khojagii Manziliy Kommunali” (“KMK”) in Kurgan-Tyube City hereinafter referred to as the employer, intends to use part of the proceeds of a loan and grant from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of Kurgan-Tyube Solid Waste Project.
3. The employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan:
— Rehabilitation of waste collection points.
4. Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
5. To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria which are further detailed in the tender documents:
a) average annual turnover is not less than 200 000 USD, calculated as total payments received for contracts in progress or completed, within the last 3 years,
b) cash-flow requirement is 40 000 USD,

c) the tenderer shall demonstrate that it has successful experience as prime contractor in the execution of at least two contracts of a nature and complexity comparable to the proposed contract within the last 3 years,

d) participation as contractor or management contractor in at least 2 contracts within the last 3 years, each with a value of at least 80 000 USD, that have been successfully and substantially completed and that are similar to the proposed works,
6. Tender documents are available electronically, on a free of charge basis,

7. Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 5 March at 14:00 pm local time, at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend.
State committee on investments and State Property Management of the Republic of Tajikistan, 27 Shohtemur Street, Dushanbe, Republic of Tajikistan.
8. The Applicable procurement rules are bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at http//www.ebrd.com/news/pulications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html
9. Prospective tenderers may obtain the tender documents, and further information through the following contract details:
